cards.name: Venusaur V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pollen Bomb
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Solar Typhoon
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Solar Typhoon.

cards.name: Weedle
cards.text: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Kakuna
cards.text: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Eldegoss V

abilities.name: Happy Match
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Float Up
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Victini
cards.text: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Incineroar V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Blitzer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Sizzlipede
cards.text: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

cards.name: Centiskorch
cards.text: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Carvanha
cards.text: With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily chomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with Basculin over food.

cards.name: Sharpedo
cards.text: It drinks in seawater and jets it from its rear to propel itself. It's very sensitive to the scent of blood.

attacks.name: Aqua Jet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Wailord V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Draw Up
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ocean Waves
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 120 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Drednaw V

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Powerful Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Drednaw VMAX

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Gardevoir V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swelling Pulse
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Gardevoir VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Cure
attacks.text: Heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Hatenna
cards.text: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

cards.name: Hattrem
cards.text: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

cards.name: Hatterene

abilities.name: Hazard Sensor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.text: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

attacks.name: Life Sucker
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Galarian Cursola V

abilities.name: Gnawing Aura
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hollow Missile
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Alcremie V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sugary Sprinkles
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sweet Splash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Alcremie VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Adornment
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: G-Max Whisk
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.text: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Machamp
cards.text: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

attacks.name: Macho Revenge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Fighting Pokémon in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Dynamite Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Lucario V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Beatdown Smash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Beatdown Smash.

cards.name: Zygarde
cards.text: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fighting Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Rockruff
cards.text: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Lycanroc
cards.text: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike.

cards.name: Rolycoly
cards.text: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

cards.name: Grapploct V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tie Up
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Moonsault Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Ekans
cards.text: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.

cards.name: Arbok
cards.text: After stunning its opponents with the pattern on its stomach, it quickly wraps them up in its body and waits for them to stop moving.

cards.name: Galarian Zigzagoon
cards.text: Its restlessness has it constantly running around. If it sees another Pokémon, it will purposely run into them in order to start a fight.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Galarian Linoone
cards.text: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémon hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Galarian Obstagoon

abilities.name: Wicked Ruler
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may have your opponent discard cards from their hand until they have 4 cards in their hand.

cards.text: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Absol
cards.text: The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and detest it, but interest in its power to predict disasters is on the rise.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Liepard
cards.text: Don't be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

cards.name: Scraggy
cards.text: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.

cards.name: Scrafty
cards.text: As halfhearted as this Pokémon's kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr's concrete pillars.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Bad Brawl
attacks.text: If you played Piers from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.text: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Inkay
cards.text: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.

attacks.name: Attack from Behind
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Confused, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Malamar
cards.text: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar's control.

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Random Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Nickit
cards.text: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

attacks.name: Filch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Duraludon V

abilities.name: Hard Coat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gatling Slug
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

cards.name: Altaria

abilities.name: Miraculous Charm
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX.

cards.text: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

cards.name: Bede
cards.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Full Heal
cards.text: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Great Ball
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Hop
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Hyper Potion
cards.text: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has at least 2 Energy attached. If you healed any damage in this way, discard 2 Energy from it.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Kabu
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If your Active Pokémon is your only Pokémon in play, draw 8 cards instead.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Marnie
cards.text: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, you draw 5 cards, and your opponent draws 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Milo
cards.text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand, and draw 2 cards for each card you discarded in this way.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Piers
cards.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and a Darkness Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Pokémon Center Lady
cards.text: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Potion
cards.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Professor's Research (Professor Magnolia)
cards.text: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Rotom Bike
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. Your turn ends.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Rotom Phone
cards.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. Then, put the card you chose on top of your deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Sonia
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon or up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Suspicious Food Tin
cards.text: Heal 80 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has at least 1 Psychic Energy attached. If you healed any damage in this way, discard a Psychic Energy from it.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Team Yell Grunt
cards.text: Put an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon into their hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Turffield Stadium
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for an Evolution Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into their hand. Then, that player shuffles their deck.,This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.
